Name: LU 20 - Zoning, 1034 – 1042 ATLANTIC AVENUE REZONING, Brooklyn (C 210386 ZMK)
Title: Resolution approving with modifications the decision of the City Planning Commission on ULURP No. C 210386 ZMK, a Zoning Map amendment (L.U. No. 20).

History.Action: Approved by Committee with Modifications and Referred to CPC
History.Description: This Resolution was Approved by Committee with Modifications and Referred to CPC
A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Roll Call.

Attachments.Name: Minutes of the Stated Meeting - February 24, 2022

{\rtf1\fbidis\ansi\ansicpg1252\deff0\deflang1033\deflangfe1033{\fonttbl{\f0\froman\fprq2\fcharset0 Times New Roman;}{\f1\fmodern\fprq1\fcharset0 Courier;}}

\viewkind4\uc1
\v0\par
\b By Council Members Salamanca and Riley\b0\par
\par
\pard\ltrpar\fi720\qj WHEREAS, \cf1 EMP Capital Group\f1 ,\cf0\expndtw-6\f0  filed an application \expndtw0 pursuant to Sections 197-c and 201 of the New York City Charter for an amendment of the Zoning Map, Section No. 16c, changing from an M1-1 District to an R7A District, changing from an M1-1 District to a C6-3A District, and establishing within the proposed R7A District a C2-4 District, which in conjunction with the related actions would facilitate the construction of a 17-story mixed use development containing 210 dwelling units, 52 to 63 of which would be permanently affordable, along with commercial and community facility space, at 1034-1042 Atlantic Avenue in the Crown Heights neighborhood of Brooklyn, Community District 8 (ULURP No. C 210386 ZMK) (the "Application");\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi720\qj\par
WHEREAS, the City Planning Commission filed with the Council on February 23, 2022 its decision dated February 16, 2022 (the "Decision") on the Application;\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\tx720\tx1440\tx2160\tqr\tx9360\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi720\qj\tx0\tx720\tx1440\tx2880\tx3600\tx4320\tx5040\tx5760\tx6480\tx7200\tx7920 WHEREAS, the Application is related to applications N 210387 ZRK (L.U. No. 21), a zoning text amendment to designate a Mandatory Inclusionary Housing (MIH) area and \cf1 amend street wall regulations\cf0 ; and C 210379 ZSK (L.U. No. 22), a special permit pursuant to Zoning Resolution (ZR) Section 74-533 to reduce required residential off-street parking to facilitate affordable housing;\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\tx720\tx1440\tx2160\tx2880\tx3600\tx4320\tx5040\tx5760\tx6480\tx7200\tx7560\tx7920\tx8640\tx8933\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi720\qj WHEREAS, the Decision is subject to review and action by the Council pursuant to Section 197-d of the City Charter;\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi720\qj WHEREAS, upon due notice, the Council held a public hearing on the Decision and Application on March 8, 2022;\par
\par
WHEREAS, the Council has considered the land use and other policy issues relating to the Decision and Application; and\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi720\qj WHEREAS, the Council has considered the relevant environmental issues, including the Negative Declaration issued September 20\super th\nosupersub , 2021 (CEQR No. 21DCP170K), which includes an (E) designation to avoid the potential for significant adverse impacts related to hazardous materials, air quality, and noise impacts (E-637) (the \ldblquote Negative Declaration\rdblquote ).\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\tx0\tx864\tx2016\tx3168\tx4320\tx5472\tx6624\tx7776\tx8928 RESOLVED:\par
\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi720\qj\tx720 The Council finds that the action described herein will have no significant impact on the environment as set forth in the (E) Designation (E-637) and Negative Declaration.\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi720\qj Pursuant to Sections 197-d and 200 of the City Charter and on the basis of the Decision and Application, and based on the environmental determination and consideration described in the report, C 210386 ZMK incorporated by reference herein, and the record before the Council, the Council approves the Decision of the City Planning Commission with the following modifications:\par
\par
\pard\ltrpar\cf1 Matter double struck out is old, deleted by the City Council; \par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\cf0 Matter \uldb double-underlined\ulnone  is new, added by the City Council\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi720\qj\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\ri140\qj\tx720\tx7560 The Zoning Resolution of the City of New York, effective as of December 15, 1961, and as subsequently amended, is further amended by changing the Zoning Map, \cf1 Section No. 16c:\par
\pard\ltrpar\fi-360\li720\sb100\sa100\cf0 1. changing from an M1-1 District to an R7A District property bounded by a line midway between Atlantic Avenue and Pacific Street, \uldb a line 150 feet northwesterly of\ulnone  Classon Avenue, Pacific Street, and a line 315 feet northwesterly of Classon Avenue; \par
2. changing from an M1-1 District to a C6-3A District property bounded by the northeasterly boundary line of the Long Island Rail Road right-of-way (Atlantic Division), \uldb a line 150 feet northwesterly of\ulnone  Classon Avenue, a line midway between Atlantic Avenue and Pacific Street, and a line 315 feet northwesterly of Classon Avenue; and \par
3. establishing within the proposed R7A District a C2-4 District bounded by a line midway between Atlantic Avenue and Pacific Street, \uldb a line 150 feet northwesterly of\ulnone  Classon Avenue, Pacific Street, and a line 315 feet northwesterly of Classon Avenue;  \par
\pard\ltrpar\sb100\sa100 Borough of Brooklyn, Community District 8, as shown on a diagram (for illustrative purposes only) dated September 20, 2021, and subject to the conditions of CEQR Declaration E-637. \par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\par
Adopted.\par
\par
